content:
Create a tauri webapp/pwa/linux/windows/mac desktop editor that presents .json files in a similar format to a graphical concept map, so instead of nested brackets, the content is grouped into ‚Äòthought bubble‚Äô type shapes--say goodbye to mismatched brackets that you have no clue where to fix and just prevent the problem in the first place!

How it's Used:

Using File > Open (CTRL-O), you can open an existing .json file for editing; alternatively, you can begin a new blank one by simply typing in the default blank bubble on the editor canvas.

When you want to begin a new brace bracket grouping, click the icon or hit <TAB> to create a child. <SHIFT>-<TAB> returns you to editing the parent node, where <TAB> again can either create a new child sibling to the first you created or return to the child, depending on settings in Edit > Preferences. 

Otherwise, using <CTRL>-<ARROW> keys navigates between child-siblings and parents. Alternatively, clicking into another bubble will change editing focus to it.

To Save the file, click File > Save (CTRL-S)

Like mindmap software, clicking on a bubble and hitting TAB starts a child node; ENTER starts a sibling, double-clicking edits in-place, etc. Nodes in json can be dragged and dropped to move them around, and best of all, there is a mechanism to annotate comments throughout, though since json cannot tolerate comments, would have to store the comments either in some metadata text file accompanying or some other mechanism you can suggest
